customrecordcustomfield.description: Used by Annual Plan Script to change the minimum post billing of previous months usage charge
customrecordcustomfield.help: Used by Annual Plan Script to change the minimum post billing of previous months usage charge
customrecordcustomfield.label: New Minimum Post Script

customrecordcustomfield.help: This field represents the Subscription that this Line Item is a member of.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Subscription

customrecordcustomfield.description: Used by script to know when to trigger the update of the quantity and included units field
customrecordcustomfield.help: Used by script to know when to trigger the update of the quantity and included units field
customrecordcustomfield.label: Charge Reference for Minimum Update

customrecordcustomfield.help: The Customer value associated with the Subscription will autopopulate here.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Customer

customrecordcustomfield.help: Enter the Item that will be used for billing when this line item is processed.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Item

customrecordcustomfield.help: Enter the Item Description that you would like to have shown on Charges generated from this Subscription Item. This field supports Handlebars.js if you want to dynamically add text.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Item Description

customrecordcustomfield.help: Enter the Start Date for this subscription item's effective period.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Start Date

customrecordcustomfield.help: Enter the End Date for this subscription item's effective period.
customrecordcustomfield.label: End Date

customrecordcustomfield.help: Enter whether this Subscription Item is to be considered a Fixed Rate (recurring), based on Usage (variable), a One-Time charge, Prepaid value, other other options.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Rate Type

customrecordcustomfield.help: For Usage based Subscription Items, choose the appropriate Rate Plan. You can set a default Rate Plan on the Item record (under the Zone Advanced Billing tab) if you want that value to automatically appear by default. You are always able to update the value on any individual Subscription Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Rate Plan

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can select a Price Level to have your Subscription Item rate based on the price set on the Item for that specific Price Level.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Price Level

customrecordcustomfield.help: If you would like the rates to be set based on an associated Price Book, you can enter the Price Book here. Price Books allow you to create more complex and multi-tiered rate plans.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Price Book

customrecordcustomfield.help: Contract Pricing gives you the most flexibility to determine the rates for specific Items. You are able to use a combination of stated contract prices, additional discount percentages, Price Levels, and Price Books per Item to determine the Contract Price. The Contract Pricing schedule also includes effective dates for when the rates apply.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Contract Pricing

customrecordcustomfield.help: Enter the Quantity to be used for this Subscription Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Quantity

customrecordcustomfield.help: Enter the Rate for this Subscription Item. For variable priced Items, this will be calculated by the associated Price Book and does not get entered here.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Rate

customrecordcustomfield.help:
Enter the Total Value associated with Fixed Charges on this Subscription Item. This value may be entered in lieu of a Rate. It is recommended to use a per Term setting on the Subscription Item with this feature so Charges are prorated based on their Term Multiplier. If a Term value is not set on the Subscription Item, all Charges will receive an equal Amount value, regardless of the time period covered by each Charge.
The Total Value is representative of the net value of Charges after discounting. If Subscription Item Discount Percentage or Discount Amount options are used, discount fields will be honored and populated on Charges accordingly. Any minor amount discrepancy due to rounding will be added to the last Charge in the series to ensure that the entire Total Value is charged.
Billed Charges will still be factored into the Total Value. If Total Value is changed, the remaining Amount will be prorated across any open Charges.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Total Value

customrecordcustomfield.help: The Currency of the parent Subscription is listed here as a matter of convenience. You cannot have Subscription Items in different currencies than the Subscription. When entering Rates or other pricing options you should make sure the currencies are compatible with the values provided.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Currency

customrecordcustomfield.help: The Term relates to the Rate field -- where the Rate would be priced per Term. For example, something could be listed as "$20 per month" even though the Rating Period or Billing Period could be Quarterly.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Term

customrecordcustomfield.help:
Enter the number of Units (Quantity or Amount) that are included and should be deducted during any usage-based calculation each period before calculating the billable amount. For non-prepaid scenarios, this value is essentially the number of free units they get each period.
For Prepaid Rate Types (Prepaid Subscription, Prepaid Item Amount, Prepaid Item Quantity), this field (in association with the Replenishment fields) enables you to limit when you want to release the prepaid allotments. You can enter the total units (total prepaid quantity or total prepaid amount) if you want the Customer to be able to consume the full balance right away. Alternatively, you can enter something like 1,000 if you want to limit the availability over time -- for example, if you are billing the prepaid amount monthly you may not want the Customer to get use of the prepaid funds until they are billed monthly.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Included Units

customrecordcustomfield.help: Enter the rate that should be applied for any usage (when the rate is not specified by a Price Book or other method) for each charge period. Entering a rate here is an alternative to setting up a single-tiered Price Book. This rate can also be used when the Included Units feature is used, whereby only charging this rate for any usage above the Included Units value (the Overage).
customrecordcustomfield.label: Overage/Usage Rate

customrecordcustomfield.help: Checking this box will create Charge records for any Included Units activity during the period. Keeping this option empty will ignore the Included Units quantity when creating Charges and only show Charges for any Overages. NOTE: If you select an "Included Units Item" on the Charge Item Map tab you will also see Charges for the Included Units (along with an offset Charge to negate the Quantity).
customrecordcustomfield.label: Create Charges for Included Units

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can enter an additional discount percentage to be applied to the rate calculated from all non-variable methods. To apply a discount to variable items you can specify this value on the Price Book.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Additional Discount Percentage

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can enter an additional discount amount to be applied to the rate calculated.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Additional Discount Amount

customrecordcustomfield.help: With the Replenishment Frequency and Replenishment Interval fields, you can set how often the Included Units field is replenished into the Customer's available balance for this Subscription Item. This enables you to give them additional Included Units during the life of the Subscription Item as opposed to a one-time Included Units value.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Replenishment Frequency

customrecordcustomfield.help: With the Replenishment Frequency and Replenishment Interval fields, you can set how often the Included Units field is replenished into the Customer's available balance for this Subscription Item. This enables you to give them additional Included Units during the life of the Subscription Item as opposed to a one-time Included Units value.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Replenishment Interval

customrecordcustomfield.help: With the Units Expiration Frequency and Units Expiration Interval fields, you can set when the Included Units expire and are no longer available for the Customer to use. This enables you to give them Included Units for a specific time period as opposed to ones that never expire. By setting this field, you are essentially setting a "use it or lose it" expiration date on the Included Units. The expiration date is based on the purchase or replenishment date of each Included Units batch.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Units Expiration Frequency

customrecordcustomfield.help: With the Units Expiration Frequency and Units Expiration Interval fields, you can set when the Included Units expire and are no longer available for the Customer to use. This enables you to give them Included Units for a specific time period as opposed to ones that never expire. By setting this field, you are essentially setting a "use it or lose it" expiration date on the Included Units. The expiration date is based on the purchase or replenishment date of each Included Units batch.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Units Expiration Interval

customrecordcustomfield.help: For Usage based Charges, enter a value here if you would like to have a Minimum Charge for this Subscription Item per rating period. If multiple charges are created under this Subscription Item in the same rating period, they will be combined to determine whether this Minimum Charge value has been achieved. In other words, this Minimum Charge does not apply "per Charge" in a rating period, but rather against the total of all Charges created under this Subscription Item per rating period.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Minimum Charge

customrecordcustomfield.help: For Usage based Charges, enter a value here if you would like to have a Maximum Charge for this Subscription Item per rating period. If multiple charges are created under this Subscription Item in the same rating period, they will be combined to determine whether this Maximum Charge value has been exceeded. In other words, this Maximum Charge does not apply "per Charge" in a rating period, but rather against the total of all Charges created under this Subscription Item per rating period. This field can be used when your Maximum Charge is the same for every rating period, whereas the Minimum Commitment functionality can be used when the values change in different rating periods.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Maximum Charge

customrecordcustomfield.help: Choose your Proration Type. This value is sourced from the Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Proration Type

customrecordcustomfield.help: You are able to choose this option to have the Charge Schedule driven by the associated record as opposed to choosing a specific Charge Schedule on this record. Inheriting from another record is common when you want all billing to go out at the same time.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Inherit Charge Schedule From

customrecordcustomfield.help: Select the Charge Schedule that you would like to use for Charges generated from this Subscription Item. The Charge Schedule will dictate the Charge/Rating Periods as well as the Bill Date cadence.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Charge Schedule

customrecordcustomfield.help: Check this box if you want to bill the Charges in arrears. This is common for Usage based items.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Bill In Arrears

customrecordcustomfield.help: This feature is not currently supported.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Initial Charge Period End Date

customrecordcustomfield.help: Select the Charge Schedule that you would like to use for Charges generated from the Rating portion of this Subscription Item when using a combination Rate Type. The Charge Schedule will dictate the Charge/Rating Periods as well as the Bill Date cadence.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Rating Charge Schedule

customrecordcustomfield.help: Check this box if you want to bill the Charges in arrears for the Rating portion of a combination Rate Type. This is common for Usage based items.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Rating Schedule Bill In Arrears

customrecordcustomfield.help: This feature is not currently supported.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Initial Rating Charge Period End Date
Exclude From Order Level Minimum Commit

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally select a native NetSuite Billing Schedule here which will push forward to the transaction line level when the Charges are processed. An example of this is a scenario where you have a one-time charge in Zone Advanced Billing that you want pushed to a Sales Order but then impose the Billing Schedule to Invoice the Customer upon the completion of related milestone tasks. NOTE: In order to use this feature you need to enable Billing Schedules at the line item level for transactions.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Billing Schedule

customrecordcustomfield.help: Enter the date this Subscription Item should be billed on for the first time.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Initial Bill Date

customrecordcustomfield.help: This field will be automatically populated as various rating processes are run and the Charge Schedule is interpreted for this Subscription Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Next Bill Date

customrecordcustomfield.help: This field will automatically be populated by various billing processes.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Next Rating Date

customrecordcustomfield.help: System field that is set during generation of charge records. It will be set to the actual charge schedule record used to generate charges.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Charge Schedule Used

customrecordcustomfield.help: Automatically populated to indicate the Subscription Item which terminated this record via the 'Subscription Item(s) to Terminate' field.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Terminated by Subscription Item

customrecordcustomfield.help: By selecting an option here, Charges that are either have an Amount of 0 or have a Quantity of 0 will not be pushed to the Transaction (example: Sales Order) upon billing. This will eliminate lines that you may not want to appear on transactions. Charges excluded using this method will have a Status of "Exempt - Zero Amount" or "Excluded - Zero Quantity" after the Create Transactions Process has run.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Exclude Charges From Billing When

customrecordcustomfield.help: Checking this box will force the Charges records associated to this Subscription Item to regenerate based on the latest data available on the Subscription Item. It should be noted that In most scenarios, the Charges will automatically regenerate when appropriate (for example if you change certain key fields (like dates) which could cause a different series of Charges). Changes to certain fields would not automatically force a regeneration of Charges but checking this box will initiate that process.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Regenerate Forecast Charges

customrecordcustomfield.help: Checking this box will delay the creation of Charges when the Subscription Item is created. This may not be modified once the record is saved. If checked, no Charges will be generated for this Subscription Item until an edit/save is made to the Subscription Item, or the 'Generate Delayed Charges' process is run for this Subscription Item, at which time this checkbox will be reset to false and hidden from the page.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Delay Charge Creation

customrecordcustomfield.help: This value automatically populates to show the total number of Count records associated to this Subscription item with a Start Date on/before today and an End Date on/after today. This value will not update for custom Count tables but can be recreated with a custom saved-search based non-stored field.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Active Count

customrecordcustomfield.help: This value automatically populates to show the total number of Count records associated to this Subscription item with a Start Date after today. This value will not update for custom Count tables but can be recreated with a custom saved-search based non-stored field.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Pending Count

customrecordcustomfield.help: This value shows the balance of the Prepaid Quantity related to this Subscription Item. This formula only includes all prepaid allocation activity including activity dated in the future.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Prepaid Balance Quantity (Including Future)

customrecordcustomfield.help: This value shows the current balance of the Prepaid Quantity related to this Subscription Item. This formula only includes prepaid allocation activity where the Bill Date is on or before today.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Prepaid Balance Quantity (Current)

customrecordcustomfield.help: This value shows the balance of the Prepaid Amount related to this Subscription Item. This formula only includes all prepaid allocation activity including activity dated in the future.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Prepaid Balance Amount (Including Future)

customrecordcustomfield.help: This value shows the current balance of the Prepaid Amount related to this Subscription Item. This formula only includes prepaid allocation activity where the Bill Date is on or before today.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Prepaid Balance Amount (Current)

customrecordcustomfield.help: Enter the amount you want to charge per unit for any Prepaid Burst activity -- which is defined as usage that exceeds the remaining Prepaid balance,
customrecordcustomfield.label: Prepaid Burst Rate

customrecordcustomfield.help:
This text will be used as the Description on individual Prepaid Burst Item Charges. This field supports Handlebars if you want to dynamically add text about the specific transaction.
NOTE: The default value comes from the Item record for this Subscription Item -- not the Prepaid Burst Item record set on this tab.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Prepaid Burst Description

customrecordcustomfield.help: On the Prepaid tab, the Burst Item and Burst Rate fields apply to Prepaid scenarios when the prepaid balance is depleted and the charges become due during the period. This will allow you to charge a different Rate and/or Item for the portion of usage that exceeds the remaining prepaid balance.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Prepaid Burst Item

customrecordcustomfield.help:
You may use an ungrouped/non-summarized Saved Search to define which Subscription Items a Prepaid Subscription Item should apply to.
The Saved Search must be of record type ZAB Subscription Item. Zone Advanced Billing will apply an additional filter to equal the same ZAB Subscription of the Prepaid Subscription Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Apply Prepaid To Subscription Items By Search

customrecordcustomfield.help: For Subscription Items that have a Rate Type of "Prepaid Subscription" select the related Subscription Items that are eligible to consume the prepaid balance. The use of this field allows you to effectively exclude certain Subscription Items from using up the prepaid balance.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Prepaid Eligible Subscription Items

customrecordcustomfield.help: Checking will apply prepaid balance to all Subscription Items on same Subscription. Checking this will take priority over other options.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Apply Prepaid To All Subscription Items

customrecordcustomfield.help: This field is used to assist the system in the calculation of Prepaid consumption for Quantity based prepaid scenarios. All usage will be calculated at this rate until the prepaid balance is depleted -- at which time the natural rates will be charged based on the pricing you have set.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Prepaid Unit Rate (for Quantity-based prepaids)

customrecordcustomfield.help:
This value initially populates from the "Default Minimum Charge Description" set (if any) on the Item record. You can set different text on this Subscription Item if you want to use something other than the default. The text will be used as the Description on the individual Minimum Charge(s) created from this Subscription Item. This field supports Handlebars if you want to dynamically add text about the specific transaction.
NOTE: The default value comes from the Item record for this Subscription Item -- not the Minimum Charge Item record set on this tab.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Minimum Charge Description

customrecordcustomfield.help:
This value initially populates from the "Default Included Units Charge Description" set (if any) on the Item record. You can set different text on this Subscription Item if you want to use something other than the default. The text will be used as the Description on the individual Included Units Charge(s) created from this Subscription Item. This field supports Handlebars if you want to dynamically add text about the specific transaction.
NOTE: The default value comes from the Item record for this Subscription Item -- not the Included Units Charge Item record set on this tab.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Included Units Charge Description

customrecordcustomfield.help:
The value entered here (if any) will be used if an Included Unit Charge is created for this Subscription Item. An Included Unit Charge shows the negative quantity of included units being applied to the Subscription Item during the rating period. Having this value separately stated enables you to report general ledger, revenue, and reporting detail of the actual usage for the period separately from the included units being applied (most commonly needed when multiple Charges are created under a single Subscription Item in the same period).
If no value is entered here but an Included Unit value has been entered on the Subscription Item, the Included Units quantity will be offset against the first Charge processed on this Subscription Item record resulting in a Charge with the net amount (actual usage minus included units).
customrecordcustomfield.label: Included Units Charge Item

customrecordcustomfield.help:
Offset Charges are created automatically during certain usage-based Prepaid Rate Plan scenarios where the amount of the initial payment is offset in a future period to enable revenue & reporting to be based on the actual usage consumed as opposed to a generic Prepaid Item. This value initially populates from the "Default Offset Charge Description" set (if any) on the Item record. You can set different text on this Subscription Item if you want to use something other than the default. The text will be used as the Description on the individual Offset Charge(s) created from this Subscription Item. This field supports Handlebars if you want to dynamically add text about the specific transaction.
NOTE: The default value comes from the Item record for this Subscription Item -- not the Offset Charge Item record set on this tab.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Offset Charge Description

customrecordcustomfield.help: Offset Charges are created automatically during certain usage-based Prepaid Rate Plan scenarios where the amount of the initial payment is offset in a future period to enable revenue & reporting to be based on the actual usage consumed as opposed to a generic Prepaid Item. The value entered here (if any) will be used if an Offset Charge is created for this Subscription Item. If no value is entered here but an Offset Charge is created the Charge record will contain the same Item as set on this Subscription Item record.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Offset Charge Item

customrecordcustomfield.help:
This value initially populates from the "Default Additional Discount Description" set (if any) on the Item record. You can set different text on this Subscription Item if you want to use something other than the default. The text will be used as the Description on the individual Additional Discount Charge(s) created (if any) from this Subscription Item. It should be noted that this Description will only apply if a separate Additional Discount Charge is created by the presence of an Additional Discount Item value. This field supports Handlebars if you want to dynamically add text about the specific transaction.
NOTE: The default value comes from the Item record for this Subscription Item -- not the Additional Discount Item record set on this tab.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Additional Discount Description

customrecordcustomfield.help:
If an Additional Discount value is present on this Subscription Item, filling in this field will create a separate Charge record(s) to contain the calculated discount amount using the Item specified. This is helpful if you want the General Ledger impact of the discount to be handled with a different Item or if you want a separate Description to accompany the discount amount.
If no value is entered here but an Additional Discount value is present on the Subscription Item, the discount amount will simply be added to the Discount field on the natural Charge(s) created.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Additional Discount Item

customrecordcustomfield.help:
This value initially populates from the "Default Overage Charge Description" set (if any) on the Item record. You can set different text on this Subscription Item if you want to use something other than the default. The text will be used as the Description on the individual Overage/Usage Charge(s) created from this Subscription Item. This field supports Handlebars if you want to dynamically add text about the specific transaction.
NOTE: The default value comes from the Item record for this Subscription Item -- not the Overage/Usage Charge Item record set on this tab.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Overage/Usage Charge Description

customrecordcustomfield.help: The value entered here (if any) will be used if an Overage/Usage Charge is created for this Subscription Item. If no value is entered here but an Overage/Usage Charge is created the Charge record will contain the same Item as set on this Subscription Item record.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Overage/Usage Charge Item

customrecordcustomfield.help:
This value initially populates from the "Default Maximum Charge Description" set (if any) on the Item record. You can set different text on this Subscription Item if you want to use something other than the default. The text will be used as the Description on the individual Maximum Charge(s) created from this Subscription Item. This field supports Handlebars if you want to dynamically add text about the specific transaction.
NOTE: The default value comes from the Item record for this Subscription Item -- not the Maximum Charge Item record set on this tab.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Maximum Charge Description

customrecordcustomfield.help:
The value entered here (if any) will be used if a Maximum Charge is created for this Subscription Item. If no value is entered here but a Maximum Charge is created the Charge record (for the Maximum Charge) will contain the Item value set under "Default Maximum Charge Item" (if any) from the source Charge Item (which may be the Subscription Item's Item value or a different value if the Charge Item was supplied by a Usage table). If that Item field is also null then the Maximum Charge will use the same Item as the source Charge Item.
Logical Order to Set Maximum Charge Item Value: 1) the Item set on the "Maximum Charge Item" (on the Subscription Item's Charge Item Map tab) 2) the Item set on the "Default Maximum Charge Item" field on the NetSuite native Item record for the source Item for this Charge (under the ZAB Settings tab) 3) the same Item as the source Charge Item (which is either set on the Subscription Item or from the Usage table if the Item is being supplied there)
customrecordcustomfield.label: Maximum Charge Item

customrecordcustomfield.help: When this option is checked, the Minimum Charge Item selected in the Charge Item Map will apply to all Charges that comprise the Minimum Amount for the period. If left unchecked, the Minimum Charge Item will only be used on the Charge representing the gap to Minimum Amount.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Apply Min Item to All

customrecordcustomfield.help:
The value entered here (if any) will be used if a Minimum Charge is created for this Subscription Item. If no value is entered here but a Minimum Charge is created the Charge record (for the Minimum Charge) will contain the Item value set under "Default Minimum Charge Item" (if any) from the source Charge Item (which may be the Subscription Item's Item value or a different value if the Charge Item was supplied by a Usage table). If that Item field is also null then the Minimum Charge will use the same Item as the source Charge Item.
Logical Order to Set Minimum Charge Item Value: 1) the Item set on the "Minimum Charge Item" (on the Subscription Item's Charge Item Map tab) 2) the Item set on the "Default Minimum Charge Item" field on the NetSuite native Item record for the source Item for this Charge (under the ZAB Settings tab) 3) the same Item as the source Charge Item (which is either set on the Subscription Item or from the Usage table if the Item is being supplied there)
customrecordcustomfield.label: Minimum Charge Item

customrecordcustomfield.help: The selected Subscription Item(s) will be terminated as of this date. After the Subscription Item(s) and Terminate as-of Date are selected, the values cannot be changed.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Terminate As-Of Date

customrecordcustomfield.help: This option provides the ability to select one or more Subscription Items that this Subscription Item is replacing. Active Subscription Items from the same Subscription are eligible for termination.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Subscription Item(s) to Terminate

customrecordcustomfield.help:
By default (if unchecked), if Consumption or Count Data is added for a Charge Period which has already been closed, during rating ZAB will find that Consumption/Count Data and create a Charge(s) with the next bill date. EX: You bill on April 1 for the March 1 - 31 Charge Period. You then add an additional usage record with a date of March 29. When you re-rate, that usage is picked up and a Charge created with March 1 - 31 Service Start/End Dates and a Bill Date of May 1.
If this preference is selected, usage data added for a closed period will NOT be picked up for rating. In this example, the usage data added for March 29 will NOT get rated (no Charge created).
customrecordcustomfield.label: Ignore Rating for Closed Periods

customrecordcustomfield.help: Optionally use this field to record and communicate descriptive information about the Subscription Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Notes

customrecordcustomfield.help:
This value indicates which type of NetSuite transaction should be generated when Charges for this Subscription Item are billed. If no value is selected, then the configured Transaction Type on the Subscription or ZAB Preferences will be generated.
Data will source into this field from the primary (header-level) Item if configured on the Item Record under ZAB Settings. A Transaction Type set on the Billing Profile may override the Subscription Item setting.
NOTE: Cash Sales are currently unsupported by ZAB Revenue functionality. Please ensure that Sales Order or Invoice is selected for ZAB Revenue contracts.
customrecordcustomfield.label: [scriptid=custcollectiontranslations_pivot_20_a915caeda51e4f77afacc3c.report_measure_69_3]

customrecordcustomfield.help: This option is designed for when there is a negative Total Amount, and the Charge Quantity is negative. When certain downstream processes in NetSuite (e.g. Item Fulfillment) require a positive Quantity and negative Rate, this feature may be used to invert both Quantity and Rate. If the Quantity of a Charge is negative, and this option is selected, Quantity will be transformed into a positive number upon creating Transactions. Rate will be inverted to a negative number, resulting in a negative total Amount. This field can also be set on Billing Profiles if using the Combine functionality.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Invert Negative Quantity

customrecordcustomfield.help:
The Shipping Method can be selected on the Subscription Item record and this value will post through to the billing transaction. Depending on whether you have "Enable Line Item Shipping" selected, the results of this field will appear in the header of the transaction or on each line of the transaction.
You can also select a Shipping Method at the Subscription level if you do not need to set individual Shipping Methods at the line item level.
Please note you will have to ensure the Shipping Method you have selected is compatible with the Subsidiary and Shipping Carrier that will apply to the transaction otherwise an error will be thrown or the field will be null during the Create Transaction process.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Shipping Method (Line Override)

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally enter the Ship To Address that you would like to use when creating a Transaction. The list of Ship To Addresses available is filtered based on the "Bill To Entity (Line Override)" and the "Ship To Address-Alternate Entity" on this Subscription Item record. The Ship To Address field value will be assessed when creating transactions to determine whether they end up on the same or separate transactions with other peer Charges from this Subscription. The decision to create separate transactions or combine with other Charges will be determined by the "Enable Line Item Shipping" setting on the Subscription record.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Ship To Address (Line Override)

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally select an Alternate Entity to allow sourcing of these additional address book entries into the "Ship To Address" dropdown list. The "Ship To Address (Line Override)" is typically sourced from the "Bill To Entity (Line Override)" but if you select an Alternate Entity here you will be able to select from both sets of address books. A common use case might be if you want the Bill To Entity (Customer on the Transaction) to remain the same but the shipping address should be from an End User address book.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Ship To Address - Alternate Entity

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally enter the Bill To Address that you would like to use when creating a Transaction. This would only be relevant if you are using a different Bill To Customer on this Subscription Item. If you do not enter a value here the default billing address for the Bill To Customer will appear on the transaction. The list of Bill To Addresses available is filtered based on the "Bill To Entity (Line Override)" and the "Bill To Address-Alternate Entity" on this Subscription Item. The Bill To Address field value will be assessed when creating transactions to determine whether they end up on the same or separate transactions with other peer Charges from this Subscription.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Bill To Address (Line Override)

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally select an Alternate Entity to allow sourcing of these additional address book entries into the "Bill To Address (Line Override)" dropdown list. The "Bill To Address (Line Override)" is typically sourced from the "Bill To Entity (Line Override)" but if you select an Alternate Entity here you will be able to select from both sets of address books. A common use case might be if you want the Bill To Entity (Customer on the Transaction) to remain the same but the billing address should be from a Partner/Reseller address book.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Bill To Address - Alternate Entity

customrecordcustomfield.description: When this is checked, the enabled ZAB Term Multiplier Calculation Plug-In Implementations are enabled to execute custom Term Mulitplier logic. If there are no plug-in(s) enabled, or the plug-in(s) enabled do not override the Term type, then the default Zone Advanced Billing logic is used.
customrecordcustomfield.help: When this is checked, the enabled ZAB Term Multiplier Calculation Plug-In Implementations are enabled to execute custom Term Mulitplier logic. If there are no plug-in(s) enabled, or the plug-in(s) enabled do not override the Term type, then the default Zone Advanced Billing logic is used.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Use Alternate Term Multiplier

customrecordcustomfield.help:
This field can be set to any number (positive or negative) to help determine the order in which Charges generated from this Rate Plan will be processed in relation to Charges generated from other usage-based Subscription Items. This field defaults from the associated Rate Plan but can be changed here for this Subscription Item.
A primary use case of this functionality would be when pricing for one usage-based Subscription Item is related to the Charges generated from another usage-based Subscription Item.
During the Execute Rating process, usage-based Charges will be sorted (ascending) using the Rating Priority value to determine which Charges to rate first.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Rating Priority

customrecordcustomfield.help: When billing Count/Usage-based Charges, this box will push any Charge activity with a Start Date after the processing date to the next bill date. The processing date is the maximum of the Period Start Date & Bill Date. EX: if you bill on 4/1 for the period 4/1-4/30 any Count/Usage records with a Start Date of 4/2 through 4/30 would be pushed to appear on the May 1 bill (as opposed to the 4/1 bill). Only Count/Usage records effective on 4/1 (plus any prior period charges) would be billed on 4/1. All other activity would be pushed until May. This field should not be used when Bill Date is being overwritten through the Rate Plan Search Map; doing so may prevent Usage from being recognized if it occurred before the overwritten Bill Date. You can default this field with ZAB Preferences or from the Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Push Future Count/Usage Charges to Next Bill

customrecordcustomfield.help:
For Count/Usage rating, ZAB will look at the previous billed period to find new Count/Usage record(s) created with Start Dates within that previous period. EX: if you bill at the beginning of April for all Count activity 4/1 - 4/30 and after billing a new Count record is created with a Start Date of 4/20, ZAB will bill for these additional Count records from 4/20-4/30 in the May bill.
Setting this to TRUE will process these changes by crediting the previously billed amount (4/1-4/30 in the example) and rebill the period 4/1-4/19 with the original Count/Usage, and bill 4/20-4/30 with the new Count/Usage. These Charges would appear in the May bill. Use this method if you have tiered pricing where the change in Count/Usage may result in a different unit rate charged.
If you set this to FALSE, ZAB will charge for the Count/Usage changes from 4/20-4/30 based only on the new Count/Usage quantities. This method should only be used when you are not using any tiered pricing options.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Credit/Rebill Prior Period New Count/Usage Charges

customrecordcustomfield.help:
Enter the Class (if any) that should be associated with this Subscription Item. This value will posted to the line item of any transaction created. The value defaults from the Subscription record but can be changed on each Subscription Item.
A value entered here may prevent certain users from seeing this record if their Role does not give them access to this Class.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Class

customrecordcustomfield.help:
Enter the Location (if any) that should be associated with this Subscription Item. This value will posted to the line item of any transaction created. The value defaults from the Subscription record but can be changed on each Subscription Item.
A value entered here may prevent certain users from seeing this record if their Role does not give them access to this Location.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Location

customrecordcustomfield.help:
Enter the Department (if any) that should be associated with this Subscription Item. This value will posted to the line item of any transaction created. The value defaults from the Subscription record but can be changed on each Subscription Item.
A value entered here may prevent certain users from seeing this record if their Role does not give them access to this Department.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Department

customrecordcustomfield.help: This field will always match the Bill To Customer value on this Subscription Item. The Entity version of the Bill To Customer field is required for filtering on Address Book fields and similar definitions.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Bill To Entity (Line Override)

customrecordcustomfield.help: The Subsidiary is defined on the Subscription record. The field is stored here for reporting purposes as well as to apply Role restrictions (if any) on the Subsidiary data.
customrecordcustomfield.label: [scriptid=custcollectiontranslations_dataset_29_684eb041b4ad44be95ecc.dataset_field_31_7]

customrecordcustomfield.help:
This field can be used if you would like to record the transactions (bills and revenue transactions) for this Subscription Item under a different Customer record. The most common example would be used for Consolidated Invoicing options. This field will be the source for other fields on the Subscription Item -- such as Bill To Entity (Line Override) and care should be taken to ensure it is compatible with the default Subscription Currency and Subscription Item Subsidiary.
Entering a Bill To Customer on the Subscription Item will force a separation process during the Create Transactions and Update Revenue Details processes to force grouping by the Bill To Customer values. Therefore, if the Subscription Items have different Bill To Customers then multiple transactions will be created.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Bill To Customer (Line Override)

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally enter an Adjustment Uplift Percentage here to be applied to the Total Value field if the value is specific to this Subscription Item. In scenarios where the value is dynamic in nature (such as based on a CPI-percentage) or a common value (not specific to this Subscription Item) you can choose an Adjustment Rate Policy that includes the dynamic adjustment amount.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Adjustment Uplift Percentage (Total Value)

customrecordcustomfield.help: This optional date can be set to establish the first date to process the Adjustment. This date will also be used as the anchor date for the Adjustment Frequency & Interval. If you leave this field blank, the Adjustment processes will use the Subscription Item Start Date (plus the adjustment period) as the first Adjustment date.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Initial Adjustment Date

customrecordcustomfield.help: Checking this box means Zone Advanced Billing will exclude any scheduled Adjustments when generating Charges under this Subscription Item until the effective date of the Adjustment. Otherwise, by default, scheduled Adjustments will be acknowledged when future-period Charges are generated. Please note that any Adjustments that rely on variable values (such as a CPI increase) will use the adjustment value in effect at the time the initial Charges are created -- but will update to the current/actual value at the time of the scheduled adjustment(s).
customrecordcustomfield.label: Adjustment Excluded Prior to Effective Date

customrecordcustomfield.help: In association with the Adjustment Frequency, this field defines the period of time to be added before each adjustment is processed. Please note that if the adjustment date is calculated to be within a billing period, the adjustment will not take place until the next billing date and the amount will not be prorated for the prior period.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Adjustment Interval

customrecordcustomfield.help: In association with the Adjustment Interval field, enter the number of periods that should occur before each Adjustment. The initial adjustment will occur based on the Subscription Item Start Date plus this Frequency/Interval combination (unless the Initial Adjustment Date field is filled in which will dictate the first adjustment). Please note that if the adjustment date falls within a billing period, the adjustment will take place with the next billing period and will not be pro-rated for the portion that was within the previous period.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Adjustment Frequency

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally enter an Adjustment Uplift Percentage here to be applied to the Overage/Usage field if the value is specific to this Subscription Item. In scenarios where the value is dynamic in nature (such as based on a CPI-percentage) or a common value (not specific to this Subscription Item) you can choose an Adjustment Rate Policy that includes the dynamic adjustment amount.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Adjustment Uplift Percentage (Overage/Usage)

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally enter an Adjustment Uplift Percentage here to be applied to the Rate field if the value is specific to this Subscription Item. In scenarios where the value is dynamic in nature (such as based on a CPI-percentage) or a common value (not specific to this Subscription Item) you can choose an Adjustment Rate Policy that includes the dynamic adjustment amount.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Adjustment Uplift Percentage (Rate)

customrecordcustomfield.help: The Adjustment Rate Policy that will be applied to this Subscription Item according to the Adjustment Schedule. This is the same list available for Renewals but can be applied within the Subscription Item term as opposed to only upon renewal.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Adjustment Rate Policy

customrecordcustomfield.help: If this Subscription Item was created from a Renewal Estimate Item the Primary Subscription Item will be listed here.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Created From Primary Subscription Item

customrecordcustomfield.help: If this Subscription Item was created from a Renewal Estimate Item the Primary Subscription will be listed here.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Created From Primary Subscription

customrecordcustomfield.help: If this Subscription Item was created from a Renewal Estimate Item the originating record will be listed here.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Created From Renewal Estimate Item

customrecordcustomfield.help: If this Subscription Item was created from a Renewal Estimate the originating record will be listed here.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Created From Renewal Estimate

customrecordcustomfield.help: The Renewal Item record that this Subscription Item converted into. The Renewal Item will show the adjustments for Rate and Item. The Renewal Item will eventually convert into a Renewal Estimate Item (on a Renewal Estimate).
customrecordcustomfield.label: Renewal Item Link

customrecordcustomfield.help: Checking this box will force Renewal Items to re-sync immediately before a Renewal Estimate is generated. Typically, this option is not recommended, as Renewal Items will already sync if key data needs to be updated. Use this feature when custom fields must be updated on the Renewal Item so they may be reflected and negotiated on an Estimate. This feature may also be helpful for Subscription Items using Renewal Rate Policies that rely on saved search data that may change over time.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Re-sync Renewal Item

customrecordcustomfield.help: If you want to set the renewal term for this specific Subscription Item to be different than the overall Subscription renewal term you can set an override value here. If these fields are blank, the Subscription Renewal Template renewal term options will apply to this Subscription Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Override Renewal Term Interval

customrecordcustomfield.help: If you want to set the renewal term for this specific Subscription Item to be different than the overall Subscription renewal term you can set an override value here. If these fields are blank, the Subscription Renewal Template renewal term options will apply to this Subscription Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Override Renewal Term Frequency

customrecordcustomfield.help: The Renewal Rate Policy that will be applied to this Subscription Item with renewal processing.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Renewal Rate Policy

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally enter a Renewal Uplift Percentage here to be applied to the Overage/Usage field (or Price Book values) if the value is specific to this Subscription Item. In scenarios where the value is dynamic in nature (such as based on a CPI-percentage) or a common value (not specific to this Subscription Item) you can choose a Renewal Rate Policy that includes the dynamic renewal amount.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Renewal Uplift Percentage (Overage/Usage/Price Book)

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally enter a Renewal Uplift Percentage here to be applied to the Rate field if the value is specific to this Subscription Item. In scenarios where the value is dynamic in nature (such as based on a CPI-percentage) or a common value (not specific to this Subscription Item) you can choose a Renewal Rate Policy that includes the dynamic renewal amount.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Renewal Uplift Percentage (Rate)

customrecordcustomfield.help: Select the default Description to be used when renewing this Subscription Item. This field supports Handlebars.js if you want to dynamically add text. This value from the NetSuite Item record but you can change on individual Subscription Items. If you do not provide a value, the existing Subscription Item Description will be used.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Renewal Item Description

customrecordcustomfield.help: Select the Item (if any) that this Subscription Item should use upon renewal. This value defaults from the Item record but can be modified on any individual Subscription Item. If this field is left blank, this Subscription Item will not renew. If you want to renew without any change to the Item, you should set the same Item value here (so that it renews to itself).
customrecordcustomfield.label: Renewal Item

customrecordcustomfield.help: The Renewal record that this Subscription Item is currently attached to. This value is driven by the Renewal Item Link since the Renewal Item can moved to a different Renewal than it was originally created under.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Renewal Link

customrecordcustomfield.help: You can optionally select a Revenue Order during creation of this Subscription Item if you would like the Revenue Details to be attached to an existing Revenue Order.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Revenue Order

customrecordcustomfield.help:
Select whether to have ZAB create Revenue transactions created within the Advanced Revenue Management (ARM) module. The setting defaults from the Item on this record but can be modified as desired. If there isn't a Revenue Configuration on the Subscription record or this field is blank then this field has no ARM impact.
Actual: the ZAB process will control the revenue impacting transactions in the ARM module and consequently any associated line items on Sales Orders & Invoices will have no revenue impact. (The 'Do Not Create Revenue Element' on the transaction line will be set to True. This field needs to be activated by request to Support in your environment.)
Forecast: the ZAB Revenue will decrease over time as the Charges are converted to billed transactions with Sales Orders & Invoices recording actual revenue. This option is often used to assist with Total Contract Value reporting.
Inherit From Item: will look at the Revenue Type on the Item record.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Revenue Type

customrecordcustomfield.description: Value populated via integration for Rev Rec
customrecordcustomfield.help: Value populated via integration for Rev Rec
customrecordcustomfield.label: Percent Completion

customrecordcustomfield.description: This value is populated via integration for Rev Rec Event creation.
customrecordcustomfield.help: This value is populated via integration for Rev Rec Event creation.
customrecordcustomfield.label: PS Revenue Event Date

customrecordcustomfield.description: This value is populated via integration for Rev Rec Event creation.
customrecordcustomfield.help: This value is populated via integration for Rev Rec Event creation.
customrecordcustomfield.label: PS Revenue Event Sync Date

customrecordcustomfield.description: This field is populated via integration and will also be populated in the Initial Bill Date field. It represents the Implementation bill
customrecordcustomfield.help: This field is populated via integration and will also be populated in the Initial Bill Date field. It represents the Implementation bill
customrecordcustomfield.label: PS KO Date

customrecordcustomfield.help: Non-stored checkbox used to make changes to Subscription Item without running any ZAB User Event scripts.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Do Not Run Scripts

customrecordcustomfield.help: This ID field is available for integrations to Salesforce to represent the unique ID.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Salesforce ID

customrecordcustomfield.help: This link shows the Plan (if any) that was used to create this Subscription Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Created from Plan

customrecordcustomfield.help: This link shows the Plan Item (if any) that was used to create this Subscription Item. The Plan Item could have been from a corresponding Plan or Plan Item Association (on the Item/SKU record).
customrecordcustomfield.label: Created from Plan Item

customrecordcustomfield.help: This link shows the Item (if any) where the Plan Item Association functionality was used to create this Subscription Item.
customrecordcustomfield.label: Created from Plan Item Association
